p: In this study, essential oils were isolated from different organs of Z. psammophilum and Z. mezoneurispinosum, two plant species endemic to Côte d’Ivoire [ 13]. For several other Zanthoxylum species, the literature reports essential oil hydrodistillation yields that range from 0.05 to 1.90% ( w/w) [ 14, 15, 16]. The yields of essential oils isolated from leaves and roots of Z. psammophilum (0.05% and 0.02%, w/w), and from leaves, trunk bark, and roots of Z. mezoneurispinosum (0.50%, 0.2% and 0.04%, w/w), that were obtained in the present study seem, therefore, to be consistent with those reported in the literature. The yield value of essential oil of 3.2% ( w/w) that was obtained from the trunk bark of Z. psammophilum seems to be high; however, it is similar to the yield obtained from dried fruits of another Zanthoxylum species ( Zanthoxylum leprieurii from Cameroon) [ 3] and can be explained by the morphology of the trunk bark of this specie presenting a thick bark.
